availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James M. Mansfield (Powell County, Kentucky, farmer and coroner.)

body.p: Powell County, Kentucky, farmer and coroner. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Ewen Mansfield. Father of William Mansfield, Mary J. Mansfield, John F. Mansfield, Marion Mansfield, Eli Mansfield, Laban Mansfield, Rachel Mansfield, Sarah Mansfield, and Benjamin Mansfield. Farmer in Montgomery County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Powell County in 1860. Coroner in Powell County in 1862. Farmer in Powell County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District No. 2, p. 53B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Powell County, p. 26.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Powell County, Precinct No. 2, p. 136A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Powell County, KY, October 1863, p. 105.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994053, Powell County Births, p. 875.
"James Monroe Mansfield (1826-1900)," Find A Grave, Memorial 171618886, Accessed August 5, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/171618886.
KYR-0001-029-0152.
